articles.description: Crystal Palace seal their first league double over Manchester United with a rampant 4-0 win at Selhurst Park.
articles.title: Olise stars as Palace thrash dismal Man Utd

articles.description: An emotional Kyren Wilson claims his first world title with a nervy 18-14 victory over Jak Jones at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield.
articles.title: World Championship: Kyren Wilson beats Jak Jones to win world title

articles.description: The Olympic spotlight can inject money and new participants into a sport and the fight to get a place on the programme is as fierce as ever.
articles.title: Olympics: New sports vie for places: Dodgeball, frisbee, teqball

articles.description: Tom Daley will compete at a fifth Olympics in Paris this summer after being confirmed in Team GB's diving team.
articles.title: Paris Olympics 2024: Tom Daley confirmed in Team GB's diving team

articles.description: West Ham manager David Moyes will leave the club at the end of the season, when his contract expires.
articles.title: David Moyes: West Ham United boss to leave at end of season

articles.description: Erik Ten Hag criticises his Manchester United side after they were thrashed 4-0 by Crystal Palace.
articles.title: Crystal Palace 4-0 Man Utd: Erik ten Hag criticises side as Casemiro has night to forget

articles.description: Which players impressed our football pundit Garth Crooks enough to make his latest Team of the Week?
articles.title: Garth Crooks' Team of the Week: Haaland, Rice, Palmer, Odegaard, Jackson

articles.description: Weightlifter Oleksandr Pielieshenko, who represented Ukraine at the Rio 2016 Olympics, dies during the conflict with Russia.
articles.title: Oleksandr Pielieshenko: Ukrainian Olympian dies during conflict with Russia

articles.description: David Moyes' West Ham tenure is coming to an end after a difficult final season - what will his legacy be among fans?
articles.title: David Moyes: West Ham manager's long goodbye ends - what will his legacy be?

articles.description: Belgium's Tim Merlier sprints to victory on stage three despite a last-minute attack from race leader Tadej Pogacar and Britain's Geraint Thomas.
articles.title: Giro d'Italia: Belgium's Tim Merlier sprints to stage three victory
